vision.notes: Sensory capabilities of Doliopsidae are currently unknown based on available data. As tunicates, they may possess light-sensitive cells or simple ocelli, but this is not confirmed for this specific family.

mechanoreception.notes: The presence and nature of mechanoreception in Doliopsidae is not specified in the provided context. Tunicates generally have some capacity to detect water movement or touch.

chemoreception.notes: Chemoreception capabilities in Doliopsidae are not detailed in the context. Tunicates likely use chemoreception for feeding and detecting suitable environments.
